website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. We like the added protection of two separate entrances in case of predators. Great for a back porch or protected carport.
pros: Perfect for outside or feral cats due to heated bedding and two separate entrances and escape doors
Can be used indoors as well
cons: Fairly light and flimsy without occupants

customer_reviews.title: Cats went in right away. Very happy so
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this outdoor kitty house for a stray mama kitty and her 5 babies, until I could find homes for them. I put food inside and within a day they were all using it. Worth every penny during this rainy season. Update: All kittens and even mama found a home!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stray cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I previously built an insulated box for some stray cats I've been feeding and although the kitties would use it occasionally, the mama cat would not. The mama cat went in and loved this heated tent right away. She and her 2 kittens will all nap in it together, so it can fit at least 3 smaller cats comfortably. They are hanging out way more often now that they have some place warm to stay. Highly recommend if you have outdoor or stray cats.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea H

customer_reviews.title: This items costs too much money to instantly have damage the second you take it out of the box due to a stupid sticker in a very
customer_reviews.text: The cat loves her house! Immediately went in and has not left for hours! However who is the genius who puts a huge sticker on a plush material! This items costs too much money to instantly have damage the second you take it out of the box due to a stupid sticker in a very bad place. It could easy be placed in the opposite side that would cause the material to actually damage
customer_reviews.author: Nicole F.

customer_reviews.title: Heating pad stopped working at 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The house was easy to assembly and the three feral cats in our neighborhood love it since it’s gotten cold out. Unfortunately the heating pad stopped working after less than 3 weeks. I wish I could get a replacement pad. The house wasn’t cheap and I expected it to last longer. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: K&H does the job again.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the quality the standard green house is, but it is pretty good. Mine warms just find and I've had it for a month now. It does not leak and water does not get in at all. I am very pleased with this size since it is much larger than the K&H standard green one. I had purchased the double one before this one and I immediately returned it because it was total garbage. I high recommend this A-frame and the standard green one.
customer_reviews.author: BAD SERVICE HERE

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't heat or stay dry
customer_reviews.text: The heating pad is about the weakest heat I have ever seen. It's not even warm to the touch after being on several hours. This says waterproof but when I checked after it rained (I had it next to a porch to block wind) it was wet on the inside near the opening. I'm not impressed for the price because a cardboard box with a tarp thrown on it would work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: EDURP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to shelter an entire litter
customer_reviews.text: A stray cat started coming around my daughter's house. My daughter fed her, and then noticed 5 little black kittens! Poor mama! My daughter decided to spay and keep the mama, and I am going to take the kittens to live in our barn. In the meantime, they needed a place to stay while we get things squared away. Cold weather is coming fast, so as usual, I looked on Amazon. This cat house was the perfect solution. Very well made, and the kittens immediately took to it.
customer_reviews.author: hoosier_CPA

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Kitty House
customer_reviews.text: My two "adopted" feral cats love this house. I put a little rug inside to help keep them warm and they immediately accepted this as their own little hideaway. Although we feed them, they are too wild to live indoors, so I am happy to know that they have some protection against our strong winds and sometimes freezing weather here in Julian
customer_reviews.author: Listening

customer_reviews.title: Not water/weather resistant!
customer_reviews.text: Not water resistant what so ever. I've had them outside for only a few days and they're completely soaked from rain. Inside and out. Top to bottom. I should have known since the walls/ceiling are very thin. The bottom is like paper. Even with both 'doors' on, they got wet. I had them under brush and trees, so I thought they would work. I bought 4 and don't have boxes to send them back in. I guess I'll keep them and wrap them in tarp, etc. Hoping for the best since my ferals won't even go in the houses when they're wet. The whole point was to keep the cats warm and dry. This A frame house doesn't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and worked well until 4 months later (April 2018) ...
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this heated cat house in December 2017. It looks great and worked well until 4 months later (April 2018) all of a sudden the heated pad stopped heating. This is very disappointing because my cats are using it every night on my front porch and we recently had some very chilly nights in Virginia. I think for the price I paid for the cat house it should've lasted longer than a mere 4 months. Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Elke L.

customer_reviews.title: Cat-Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have two semi-feral rescued cats who prefer to reside primarily outdoors, even in the worst weather. We have a good sheltered area attached to the back of our house and already had a standard cat tree with box-type shelters, but I wanted something with supplementary heat and some added protection from wind and especially when it is cold, windy, and wet all together. Each cat seems to love this shelter, but unfortunately they won’t share it—i wish it had a divider right down the center line from front to back! It was a bit pricey for our budget but I am very happy to see at least one of my cats curled up in it every morning.
customer_reviews.author: V. R. Sands

customer_reviews.title: Nice shelter for feral cats
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a couple feral cats we care for. The price is hefty, but the cats have shelter from the adverse weather. We keep this on our covered porch for added protection from the elements. They wouldn’t go in with the plastic coverings on the entrance, but as soon as I took those off, they went in and have been using it as their shelter daily for weeks now. Overall, it’s a great shelter for feral cats!
customer_reviews.author: susan13

customer_reviews.title: Works great for outdoor cats.
customer_reviews.text: Set one up under the patio overhang for outdoor "feral" cat - she moved right in! Loves it, she's in there every day. Feel better knowing she's getting some warmth. You must have an outdoor plug near by. When putting the heated sheepskin pad inside the tent, be sure to thread the cord through the hole provided. The tent closes with Velcro. I put it up off the ground on a low table, with both exit doors having clear space to get in and out. Removed the clear door flaps for now, until she gets used to it and realizes that it's not some kind of trap. Very successful product!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: 2 cats loving their house!
customer_reviews.text: I'd gone through several electric blankets for our cats who sleep in the garage, and the controllers kept dying. This heated pad has a much more durable cord that's suitable for outside. The pad never feels hot when cats aren't around, but if you stick your hand in there right after the cat gets up, it is nicely warm. We have 2 sleeping in it, but definitely could fit another cat or 2 if they are friendly when it's cold. The outside is a durable canvas type fabric. It folds flat if you un-velcro the corners.
customer_reviews.author: Techmom

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a couple stray cats living by the back of my house. They love it! does everything it says it does, super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: L. Yip

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it and so do we
customer_reviews.text: Our outdoor cat sleeps in the garage at night. But in the winter the garage can get cold. This heated house has been a game changer. We can always find Shadow enjoying this house, when we pet him his belly is toasty warm from lying on the heated mat. So much nicer for both the cat and our electric bill. (Last year....before we knew about this product we ran space heaters and our electricity bill was through the roof). No increase in this month’s bill with this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size for kitty family!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to move mother cat and 4 kittens to a new nest. She gave birth in the single cat size heated house 8 days ago. Now they can stretch out for nursing. We are not using the window flaps. She has self warming furry pad taped to floor reinforcement andagallon jug of water is across each exit which she crawls over to the cave like interior. Nice brown color house isplaced by the slidiing glass door on a covered deck. Mother cat refuses to be inside. Fortunately California’s weather is warming.
customer_reviews.author: J Myrner

customer_reviews.title: well worth it for your outdoor kitties
customer_reviews.text: we have a stray cat that as basically claimed us as his own. so we wanted to get him something warm to sleep in during the colder months. he absolutely loves this thing! the cover on the mat is super easy to remove and clean in the washer/dryer as well. we keep ours in a car port so its not being hit directly by rain or snow so i cant speak to how well it might hold up under those conditions. but for using it outside, but in a covered area it works wonderfully and the cat is quite taken by it.
customer_reviews.author: Strid3r

customer_reviews.title: Perfect A Frame for your outside kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My cats have officially moved to living outside after getting this for them. They love to snuggle in their little house. It has two entrances and they use both. The heated mat isn’t too powerful, and provides a good amount of heat to keep things warm, but definitely not hot. I can’t say it’s completely waterproof, as it is under my porch and a portion of it got wet and it took a while to dry off (it was soaked). So while it is a swishy type of fabric, it does absorb water. Might could use a good tarp over it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Feral cats LOVE this heated outdoor tent
customer_reviews.text: Feral cats LOVE this heated outdoor tent: I have two. I bought tarps and fitted them to make more weather-proof, since I do not have a covered area to put these. I used Gorilla duct tape to seal. I made sure there was a couple of inches of "overhang" to help keep rain/snow away from both doors. Have to re-tarp and duct tape after one winter, will make these last. Also, get them up off of the ground - I used 2x4's so raid water/snow didn't sit/soak. Must check every so often to make sure the kitties are staying dry. RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: DHHoy

customer_reviews.title: Warm cat house - Added a picture of cats.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Kitty House for 2 outside Feral cats that visit us. They love it. It is warm and keeps them warm inside. The 2 of them sleep together in it. We had to take one of the plastic clear doors off because they were not sure how to get in our out. They love it. It keeps the wind and snow and rain out, I cannot say enough good things about this purchase. As you can see, the two cats love it they snuggle together on cold days.
customer_reviews.author: Oberlin College Theater Dept.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We care for outdoor cats and with winter approaching wanted something that could provide shelter. We live in Central NJ. This product, with the heating floor mat works perfectly. I know it works because I’ve placed my hand on the mat and felt it warm up. It does not get hot. It warms up just enough to take the edge off the bitter cold. 2 of the cats have taken to it. I placed a cam inside to see who is in there.... I also surrounded the tent with additional insulation and tarps. I’ve recommended this product and their heated water bowl to many and highly recommend it to all.
customer_reviews.author: Caring for outdoor cats

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitty tent house
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a kitty that likes to visit us. We wanted a safe/ warm/ dry place for him to sleep. My son put it together while I was at work, we put a bowl of cat food inside and the kitty started using it the same day. So far it's only seen torrential downpours and extreme heats, but he really seems to like it so I don't think winters will be a problem for him and his new tent house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trombley

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof
customer_reviews.text: Description says " water-resistant/water-proof ". item seems to be neither. First tried it as received but rain soaked through the top; then applied a heavy coat of Scotchguard - same result. This is in S Florida with plenty of rain but the pet house should withstand rain better than the one I received to be called even water-resistant. Have tried to use for over two months - will be discarding.
customer_reviews.author: vacation home owner

customer_reviews.title: Kitties Are Enjoying
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived as described. Made of sturdy materials. The heated pad gets just warm enough to keep kitties comfortable without getting too hot. It took about a week before they would have anything to do with it, so I would recommend having some patience if your cat doesn't take to it right away. Eventually our two cats ventured to investigate and after that, they slept in it every single night. They definitely looked cozy and content!
customer_reviews.author: Bullfrog Prints

customer_reviews.title: Cord is somewhat short ...
customer_reviews.text: The cord comes out from a hole at the bottom of the "house". and limited where I could place the house. I am using it inside my un-insulated, un-heated garage for 3 "kittens (under 1 year of age) that were orphaned when the mama barn cat died. Cats are accepting of it, one seems to "own" it, but lets the others in. : ) I did put wood boards under it to help insulate it from the cement floor of the garage - which is not attached to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Mommu

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor kitties
customer_reviews.text: We have some (likely stray) cats that started to hangout in our yard. We can't take them in as we are already at max cat capacity in our home. Since the weather is starting to get cold, we purchased the heated version and put it outside on the patio under an awning. The kitties love it. We turn on the heat pad at night, but they typically stay in it for most of the day. They recommend not leaving the heating pad plugged in all the time. It is also nice to have the option to remove the plastic flaps that cover the door. We might put those back on as the weather gets colder. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RatherBeOutside

customer_reviews.title: You could fit a whole pile of kitties in the A-framed house!  It’s bigger than you think.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised at how big this A-framed cat house actually is. I have 3 of the regular house-shaped heated ones by K&H that my outdoor kitties LOVE and stay in them all winter long, that I’ve had for a few years now and they’re still holding up wonderfully. But only 1 cat can comfortably fit in those at a time. So if you have 2 or more cats that like to cuddle together, get this larger sized one. You could fit a whole pile of kitties in this thing! Also it is so very quick & easy to put together!
customer_reviews.author: KrisML

customer_reviews.title: Great for outside cats.
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral neutered cat that I have been feeding for three plus years and still cannot pet him. We live in Arizona on acreage in the desert and it gets cold in the winter at night. I bought this and put it in a safe place inside the walled backyard and he has used it all winter. It worked great and was nice and cozy. Yes, I am crazy but can't stand to see any animal starve or be cold.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it. I got one for my ferals last ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I got one for my ferals last year and this year I decided to get another since I have about 5 and some are chubbier than others haha
customer_reviews.author: Sara Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Outdoor house
customer_reviews.text: Best heated kitty house for the winter on the market. It folds up flat and assembles with easy Velcro strips. 2 clear doors are removable. The heating pad gets just moderately warm, no overheating and has a standard plug it. My outdoor feral cats love it. I still recommend to have it set up on a porch or somewhere where it’s not exposed to lots of rain and I raised mine and sat them on a wood pallet.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sooo easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: We have barn cats everywhere since our neighbor died and I like these. We’ve used them for a couple years. I just bought another one. They are rediculously easy to put up and store great for the winter! We have never put ours out in the direct elements because it’s not uncommon for us to get 2 feet of snow in one night. Pretty sure it’s not strong enough or waterproof enough for that- but I could be wrong. We just tuck ours under the porch, in the barn, etc. the cats love them and we have a small rat terrier that loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Old Ladies Warm🔥 Cat Tent
customer_reviews.text: Best cat tent for my old lady. She loves it now. Took a week for her to figure it out. So we started feeding her inside it. It's great to have a pressure sensitive heating pad too. It withstands a lot of wind and rain. Some water still splashes in through the flaps. If they were a little wider I think it would really keep out any splashing in. I may have to build a little platform to keep it off the deck. Otherwise I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Max Wiederhold

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: It took the feral cats who come on my porch on cold nights several days to go inside the tent but once in they seem to like it. I removed the clear plastic flaps so they would go inside but it was not a problem. The tent is well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Patti in TX

customer_reviews.title: The feral cats enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: This product is true to its description. The low level heat has been an adequate supplement to the cats own body heat. I take care of 3 feral siblings and they all enjoy the large cat house. I would give it 5 stars if it were a bit larger to comfortably fit 3 cats (less than 1 yr old). It was a life saver when we just had 8 inches of snow, that's where they stayed!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Zeh

customer_reviews.title: My ferals love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two families of feral cats that I've TNRd and have been feeding and sheltering for a couple of years now. I have a variety of shelters, some single occupancy and some big enough for 2 cats. I got this A-Frame a couple of months ago and it quickly became a favorite. It is rarely empty. I think the cats enjoy being able to sit up inside it. Mine is on a covered patio so I don't have to worry about snow but I feel it would perform well in rougher conditions. A great product and I may soon be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE

customer_reviews.title: Best thing you can do for the ferrel kitty's in your neighborhood!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We've bought 3 of these houses for the ferrel kitty's in the neighborhood so far. They love them. I always see them going in and out of them. The heated pad spans the whole floor. Keeps them nice and warm. I've caught eight of them so far and got them spayed and neutered with the operation sterile feral program here in Missouri. There are two more that I hope that I can catch before they get pregnant again or else I might have to buy another house.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Multiple Cats
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected. Easily will accommodate 3 cats. Took seconds to put together. It belongs somewhere where it would be protected from the elements. It's not sturdy enough to stand alone outdoors. I put this one in my sunroom.
customer_reviews.author: go green

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time for the cold weather. Took my cat a day or two to get aquatinted but he uses it all the time now. Don't expect it to get extremely warm to the touch but if you reach in when the cat is laying on it you will feel the warmth. I set it out without the door flaps first so the cat could easily see both exits (important for a cat) and then I closed one with the doors provided to limit the breeze. Needs to be under a covered patio to protect cord from the elements. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Torres

customer_reviews.title: 6 years and counting!
customer_reviews.text: Have had our cat house nearly 6 years. The cat still loves it. The only item needing replaced is the heated pad cover. Which in 6 years time being outside in the garage is expected. Good product and does great job keeping the car warm. We do elevate it some so it’s not directly on the concrete in the winter time.
customer_reviews.author: Calaways

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shelter for my kitties
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 very large cats. They love their new heated chalet. They spend a lot of time in there together even on sunny days. I look in and they are usually in there snuggled up together. It's also really nice for them to have a warm shelter in the rain and snow. The outside of the house gets wet, and there has never been an issue with any rain on the inside. There's also room to feed my cats in it on rainy days. Plenty of room for them both to fit in there with their food bowls. My cats are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: guido

customer_reviews.title: it has worked just as well for me and seems like it will hold up fine
customer_reviews.text: Larger and different from the smaller heated cat house, it has worked just as well for me and seems like it will hold up fine. My cat likes it just as much if not more. The soft bottom takes some getting used to, but seems to work fine. The cord is a bit harder to deal with because of the way it leaves the pad compared to the smaller version. If they could make the cord leave the pad right at the corner it would work better. The cord placement in the smaller pad was better.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I came into a situation where my kitties had to live outside. I obviously don’t want them to be cold or suffer in the winter so I bought them this within two days they were using it permanently all cuddled up in side they seem to like it a lot it’s the right size and the right shape I think they’ll be happy kitties
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Kitties loved it.
customer_reviews.text: With temperatures dropping I wanted to provide something for the feral cats that are hanging around my house. They are all under 6 months so I wanted to protect them but couldn't bring them in because of my cats. This A frame provided good cover for them and with the self-warming crate pad and the 3 cats getting in the house, they came through like troopers. Easy to set up and cost wasn't prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: G. Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and it does just what is advertised....my problem is getting the feral cat to use it instead of my own cat! So far, only wind driven rain comes in but thats because I removed one if the plastic doors. I sat it out on a bench, close enough to reach outdoor outlet. Be sure to invest in an outdoor extension cord!
customer_reviews.author: Morton

customer_reviews.title: Worked for the outside cats during the winter fo 2018-'19.
customer_reviews.text: My cats took to it in an instant! I thought it might take them a few days to figure out the doors and actually use it - NOPE more like 30 minutes! When the temps hit 0 Degrees F we threw a heavy rug and blankets over it to provide some addition R value insulation. Cats loved it. Now that it isn't need for the summer, we will see how easy it is to clean and store away.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Gagermeier

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I love this kitty shelter. I have a feral kitty that is so happy to have a warm bed to sleep in at night. It was easy to assemble and took only minutes. I like that the soft cover can come off of the heating pad element and be washed. I would recommend this to anyone and I would buy again. I bought the large one so kitty could stretch out. I have this placed by my back door and I put a sheet of styrofoam under it to keep out dampness and to keep the bottom cleaner. My goal is to become his friend and find a happy home for him eventually. Merry Christmas cat lovers..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Barn Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Set this bed up late on a 30 degree night in a small barn occupied by 3 cats (sometimes 4), put a small handful of dry food in the bed to coax them in, and left. We watched from the video camera and all three cats were in there less than 30 minutes after set up. We've checked the camera a few more times and they already know it belongs to them and they seem to love it! The bed was worth it and now I don't have to worry about the temps for the rest of the winter.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Cat's Meow
customer_reviews.text: We're retired in the sticks. The wife wanted some outdoor mousers so we picked up some hand raised cats from our friends. I set this up in the garage with a cat door to the outside. We'll there's no question that the cats have a home to sleep that will be warm in the winter. I checked on in when we were below freezing the other day and the cats were happy, the pad was putting out the right amount of heat.
customer_reviews.author: CAPT Seabee

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter this fall
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a momma cat and her kittens that showed up at our house very hungry and malnourished but not trusting humans. My hope was that we could give them some shelter and work on earning trust from the kittens. So far so good they are using it and kittens are letting me stay closer to them when they eat now. The mat doesn't get as warm as I thought it would. The shelter has stayed dry through some heavy rains and stayed put during some windy days. Glad I found this, it is helping me get help for some precious kittys.
customer_reviews.author: DKAlpha

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent...
customer_reviews.text: Our old outside scrapper loves his little house outside... He looks cozy and warm on the cold winter nights... I put it on our front porch anchored to a raised platform and it has stood up to the toughest winds so far... As far as being waterproof, I binged a small tarp over the top to keep it extra dry...
customer_reviews.author: Ron Caton

customer_reviews.title: The plus is the dual doors. They dont feel safe if there isnt an escape if needed
customer_reviews.text: Used for outdoor community cats to help keep them warmer, drier and safer. The plus is the dual doors. They dont feel safe if there isnt an escape if needed. Love that I can easily keep it clean. Now it's spring and momma kitty will be having kittens in it any day now.
customer_reviews.author: VICKI LYNN

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read the reviews. I bought this for some neighborhood cats to have a warm space in the deep cold of winter. It will hold two cats it they get along or three if they cuddle really close. I put mine on a small riser by the house to keep it out of the wet muck, under a gazebo to keep rain and snow mostly off, and wedged between heavy patio items to keep it in place when the wind picks up. The warmth from the mat keeps cats coming back. Will likely but a second in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marx

customer_reviews.title: ... it out the first night and use it quite happily. It's weathered the rain fine as far as ...
customer_reviews.text: The feral cats figured it out the first night and use it quite happily. It's weathered the rain fine as far as I can tell. The fake fleece is white and grabs firmly to any leaf debris that gets tracked in. A brown fabric that I could clean would be much better. It's warm but not hot. Plenty roomy for 2 cats and on a really cold night I think three could share. Exceptionally easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: H. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Not adequate for outside exposed area. Provides minimum amount of heat
customer_reviews.text: The structure is very flimsy, just fabric. It is not waterproof. It Will blow away if left out side. Needs to be in a sheltered area like a barn or garage. The heating pad does not get warm at all. Thought it was broken until I brought it inside to feel the slightest amount of heat when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: REBA B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kitty house a year ago but wanted to see what condition it would be in later after being outside. I do keep the house on a covered front porch to help protect the house some what. It does heat up nicely in only a few minutes to a comfortable temperature for your fur baby. Does come with 2 removable door flaps that attach with velcro to keep water and wind out. I now have a happier cat that doesn't have to come inside on those cold nights. I am purchasing another one today for a feral cat that I found in an empty house this past summer. Couldn't be happier with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Classybabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our feral cat and kittens! Will have to figure out how to winterize it for all the snow this winter since it is a canvas material. Right now it’s in our covered entryway but will be moving it to the patio deck as soon as kittens are bigger! Not using the heated pad yet so can’t comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted
customer_reviews.text: I have 10 cats and not 1 cat would go inside no matter what I do. And the heated padding is not warm enough. This worked for some buyers which is good but I just wasted my money. I should have just bought a cheaper self-heating pad for my 2 outdoor cats instead of this expensive tent that stays empty 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Getting them to use it.
customer_reviews.text: So the house is great. I was skeptical whether our cats would use this bed and I was right to doubt them. So I forced them to go through the bed everytime they wanted to go in and out. This worked like a charm. Now we will just have to wait to see if they will use it when it REALLY gets cold.
customer_reviews.author: Yonner

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! My cats love it. I use it indoors, because one of my cats likes to try to sleep under my bed-covers. He gets cold easily. He is so happy with this tent. It's also not too-tiny. A lot of cat-beds seem to be made for kittens, because no one I know, with cats, can fit their cats into them. Not this one! Definitely worth it. May buy another for the neighborhood's outdoor cat.
customer_reviews.author: Vira

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Our outdoor cats love this house, 2 adult cats sleep in this one, it keeps them warm during the bitter winter and keeps them comfortable throughout the year. The adult cats barely fit in here, we have a few heated houses for them to choose from but they are siblings and choose to squeeze into this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy - Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I like that this kitty house is well quality made. I have it in the garage and have not seen any of my ferals run out of it when I enter. (that does not mean they have not been in it) I just realized that the plastic flaps/doors are removable and that could be why. Plus we have not had a winter with the usual cold and snow. My ferals were getting a warming bed with a cloth over it and I put it in a box that I laid sideways. This one is so much better to keep them warm even when I take the flaps off tomorrow not much wind will enter.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: This product is great! We have two outdoor kitties and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! We have two outdoor kitties and I am pretty sure one of them never leaves this little house. The heated seems just right, it is not hot, but just warm enough to keep the little furballs happy. Ours is under a slight overhand against the side of our house. It has been rained on, hailed on, and covered in snow and still looks in good shape. ALSO for extra insulation and protection from moisture I would recommend putting something between the ground and the house. I picked up an "anti-fatigue standing mat" from harbor freight for less then $10, used a section of it for under the house. Works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley S.

customer_reviews.title: Not cat approved :(
customer_reviews.text: I really like this but the cats don't seem to. Can't get them to use it. I tried putting treats and wet food inside but no luck. I took off one of the plastic covers on the end to see if that would encourage them to go in, it did not.
customer_reviews.author: JEANNE S

customer_reviews.title: Durable and practical.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have 2 for my feral cats. I just finished wrapping the inside walls with insulation. Then I put a body heat reflecting pad on the bottom for the really cold days. In the summer the other one is great for shade or rainy days. They are sturdy and durable and can be cleaned with a scrub brush, soap and water. Great to use in many different places. The price is just right. I wouldn't pay more.
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My older cat took over the house - on really cold nights there is one other cat that gets in the house with her. There is room for three to snuggle up together. You will not feel heat on your hand when you touch the pad - but if you put a towel or pillowcase over the pad you can feel the heat. As stated there are two openings for the house. My suggestion would be to have a flap that can attach to either opening. We have had some really strong cold winds - I had to get a towel and a clothes pin to rig a flap to keep the wind from blowing through the house.
customer_reviews.author: pupmom

customer_reviews.title: Happy Cats!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 (now) outdoor cats. Our cats love this little home. It took them all winter to learn how the share it but next year they'll be pros. It's definitely warm enough for them in Virginia winters. It's easy to assemble, move, plug in. I only wish the cord was a little big longer. It also makes for nice shelter in the summer. You can remove the plastic flaps to allow for breeze.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelVA

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. It is durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is durable, well engineered, easily assembled, and easily cleaned. I have four outdoor cats and initially purchased one multi-cat A frame. The cats quickly figured out that this was a luxury accommodation. However, it was monopolized by two of the cats so I ordered a second one. Now all cats have access to warmth and a comfortable bed. I will add that the cat condos are on a porch so they do not get the full force of bad weather, just the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together and warms up nicely
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a decent outdoor cat product. It was easy to put together and warms up nicely. I have it outside for strays that may need shelter in the winter. I have it located near my house, under the roof overhang so that it is mostly sheltered from precipitation. I also placed it on pallets to keep it off the ground to help keep it dry. I do not think this house would be good in an entirely unprotected area. It comes with clear, plastic door flaps attached. I haven't noticed much activity in this shelter yet. I may experiment with moving (or removing) the flaps in case the strays are frightened of the flaps (some are).
customer_reviews.author: Lydia H.

customer_reviews.title: Great house for outdoor kitty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 3 outdoor feral cats. We have done TNR with them & feed them regularly. They normally live down the storm drains in our street, but thought I would give them something a bit more comfortable. Well they love it! They use it regularly now. I have it in a sheltered area, behind a bush & close to our house. The overhang keeps the rain & snow out too! Would not recommend putting it in an open area. It has some weight to it, but could possibly get blown away. Will fit 1-3 cats inside though & according to our ferals it is comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Ivanauskas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for colder weather
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 barn cats love this! Never noticed any change in my electric bill and this is continually plugged in for 6 to 7 months (Michigan weather) We left 1 door cover off as they prefer that but they've gotten used to it now and will use the flap door side as well. Cover washes nicely and once it's warmer out I just take the heating pad element out and they continue to use the comfy bed house all year long.
customer_reviews.author: family of 8

customer_reviews.title: MUCH BIGGER Than Expected!!! Awesome! :)
customer_reviews.text: perfect for mama cat & two babies! Much bigger than i thought! Someone said in the reviews below that “it’s only large enough for two cats.” NO. It can DEFINITELY fit at least FOUR fully grown cats. this thing is awesome. Also, thank you, so much for the wonderful and FAST shipping too, man! I just ordered it two days ago, and wasn’t expecting it for another week! God bless. Thank you. My cats outside are so happy, and will be warm this winter! :)
customer_reviews.author: Holly Burton

customer_reviews.title: The idea is fantastic. However the cord that comes with it is ...
customer_reviews.text: The idea is fantastic. However the cord that comes with it is VERY short! It is not ideal for outdoors where you would need to put it for ferals and it burned up the extension cord where it was plugged in. It is not recommended you use one, however there is no way to plug it in otherwise unless you are right next to an outlet, which in most cases is not likely! I used it in my garage for my ferals and thankfully did not have a fire. I would not get this unless you are planning to use it indoors in an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: czhammer

customer_reviews.title: Warm Bed for Elderly Cat
customer_reviews.text: My blind elderly outdoor kitty (who insists on living outside) LOVES this bed and shelter. Would not recommend for outdoor, uncovered use as it’s not very sturdy. Would not withstand high winds. Because I use this in my garage with the roll-down door ajar, I’m giving it 5 stars based on my personal use. I still bring kitty inside when the weather is below 20 or so with wind chill. I live in KY and the winters are not (usually) severe.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie WilliamsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is a fabulous idea for outside cats!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this heated cat tent! Our outdoor cats use it daily during the cold weather. They usually take turns being inside but when it's really cold, we have seen two at a time in there. It's well worth the money and is simple to fold up and store away during summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kat White

customer_reviews.title: Feral Cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: One of my ferals is in this bed in my garage all the time now. I am so happy he is staying warm. He likes laying right at the front (I left off the velcro attached clear "door" on front side so he has a perfect view of the cat door to see who is coming in! When its really cold (below zero) he prefers the insulated container I made with the K&H heat pad and straw added, but most nights (teens,twenties) he's in this one with the big ground level opening (he can scoot out quick-so I think that makes him feel safe)
customer_reviews.author: nysbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Very perfect for winter
customer_reviews.text: My cats had zero interest in this house at first and I figured I'd wasted alot of money. Then the weather got cold, FAST!! 2 cats share it this winter & one or both are in it most of the time if it's cold out. I didn't want wind flowing through it so I tossed a fleece blanket over it to drape over one of the doors & shoved it against a wall. My cats don't like the clear door so I left it off. It's in an area that is somewhat protected. Great buy! I feel good about outdoor cats during winter weather now.
customer_reviews.author: CJPB

customer_reviews.title: Coziest Mountain Kitty, Ever!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the heated cat house three years ago after we were adopted by a stray. She still loves it, especially the dual entry/exit. She prefers outdoor living most of the time and when the weather turns colder she heads straight to that heading pad. The pad doesn’t seem to be working now (It’s plugged in about 6 months out of the year) so I’m buying a second one! The kitty house is kept in the garage where she has access all the time. Very happy, cozy kitty! 😸
customer_reviews.author: KathLena

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these from a couple years ago and this one lacks the coil around the power cord to keep from animals inadvertently hurting themselves by chewing on it. Otherwise, it’s the same which is good because my animals love snuggling in it during the cooler weather months.
customer_reviews.author: A. Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This cat house is easy to set up, within 5 minutes out of the box. We placed it on top of a deck box and it has withstood the snowy weather. The cats are staying warm and dry and feel secure. Fits two adult cats.
customer_reviews.author: MomnCrew6

customer_reviews.title: Not super spacious.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love K&H and this house. My only complaint is that my two kitties cannot fit in it together. I figured it would much more spacious. I attempted to make a make shift divider for them but it still was not comfortable enough for them to both fit in. Overall I would probably go with the cheaper smaller ones and buy more quantity for comfort for my kitties. I would have returned and swapped them out but by the time I realized they wouldn’t both use it due to a lack of space it had already been used so I didn’t feel right about returning.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shelter for your outdoor feral cats
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for a few years now and the outside feral cats love these. They are protected from the elements and it keeps them safe and warm. Very easy to assemble and clean. Extremely sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde P. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Feral cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The feral cat really seems to be enjoying it. We put it on the covered patio on top of a anti-fatigue kitchen mat. We also covered it with a rain tarp for added protection as the patio cover leaks a bit and ran can also blow in on a windy day/night. So far, so good. He is really liking it. My little shih tzu lays inside at the patio door, the cat at the doorway of his new home and they just look at each other sometimes. :)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Manning

customer_reviews.title: The A-frames provide protection from the cold, but coverings needed in heavy rain to keep them dry.
customer_reviews.text: The stray cats are using the A-Frames I purchased. I am mostly very happy with the product, but wish they had feet on them so they didn't get wet inside when it rains. I have covered them with tarps and added light weight plastic on top to help keep the inside dry when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Kitty likes his new K&H  A-Frame.
customer_reviews.text: The A-Frame was easy to assemble. We did take the removable door off so our cat would go in. We put it on our enclosed, screened-in porch. He already had a box with an old robe in it that he liked to sleep in, so we didn't know if he would go in the A-Frame, but he was using it within a few days after we placed it on "his" porch. We are happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitty house
customer_reviews.text: We love this little house. . We built a surround for it, because we use it outside. We also added straw for added warmth in the cold Chicago winter. This is a sturdy little enclosure and it looks like it will be easy to clean come spring. I took the front flap off but kept the back flap on to keep in some of the warmth.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Cats are warmer now.
customer_reviews.text: WOW! We have 3 feral cats that adopted us. Two females that stick together were in it as soon as I had it set up and pretty much stay in there when not eating. Cold PA temps have been hard on them and I am so happy they took to it that I immediately ordered a 2nd for the male cat that hangs around. Great purchase. I ordered a heated bed for my indoor older cat so can't wait for its arrival to try it out as she currently lays up against heating vents. Definitely recommend. Super fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Pile of cozy cats in the tent every morning
customer_reviews.text: We inherited a family of barn cats when we moved to a rural mountain property last year. They're too skittish to come inside even when it dips down into the single digits, so we bought this heated tent in hopes they'd at least have somewhere warm on winter nights. They ignored it for about a week, until we decided to try opening up the side flap to make a bigger entrance/exit, and we put a small food dish near the tent to encourage them to come check it out. That did it—we now wake up to a pile of sleeping cats in the tent every morning. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Tee I.

customer_reviews.title: Spoil your cats with this house
customer_reviews.text: The best car house we’ve had. Was concerned our barn cats wouldn’t get in... it always has 2 cats at a time in there. Great investment. We put a child’s blanket in there so I can wash it monthly.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price and peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: We have a family of feral cats that we take care of and they love these tents in the winter...we had temps in the teens this past winter and they stayed in the tent all day and night. We have had the tents for 3 winters now. Needs to be kept on a covered porch or in a garage. I highly recommend this for anyone that has outdoor furr babies. We have 5 cats and have purchased 4 ...
customer_reviews.author: Georgiarose

customer_reviews.title: Your a better pet owner than me if you can convince you cat to go in!
customer_reviews.text: We gave up after 3 months. Neither of our two long term mouser cats would go in, but rather eat and sleep outdoors or in my house. Sorry I bought it.It is sun bleached and not returnable now.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I've actually insulated this pretty well so she stays warm all winter
customer_reviews.text: This cat house is a life saver for my cat. I've actually insulated this pretty well so she stays warm all winter. I have 2 heavy blankets covering this house and a waterproof tarp wrapped around it to keep it insulated and waterproof. I have felt the heated pad on some pretty cold mornings and she is very toasty inside. Very happy with this product and my cat loves it.
customer_reviews.author: kpratz

customer_reviews.title: Not truly outdoor
customer_reviews.text: It says outdoor but it is not truly "outdoor". You have to keep it shielded from the elements. The flap lets in water so it has to be under something to protect it from rain, it is very light so it can blow away.
customer_reviews.author: Puffyfish

customer_reviews.title: " The cats like them, but we've had some 1" rain storms ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two outdoor cats and just moved. The last house had a large shed with a window and power, so they were safe and dry. The new house has no shed, so I bought two of these "kitty tents." The cats like them, but we've had some 1" rain storms in the past few days and the tents were wet to the touch. My next attempt to protect the cats will be two large dog houses with these tents inside. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great house for feral kitties
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this. I keep it in my garage for some feral cats and they much prefer this to another one I bought. At any time we have about 3-4 cats that make this home. I can’t speak to the weatherproof aspect since it is in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Elwyn S Fleming

customer_reviews.title: The kitties love this house!
customer_reviews.text: The ferals on our block love this heated house! They can fit three, maybe four, cats at once. The pad only heats when they are laying on it which is great! We can now rest easy on bitter cold days knowing that the ferals are warm and safe. This is the best house! It stays dry too which is a great feature and it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carly M

customer_reviews.title: amazing!
customer_reviews.text: After an extremely cold night, I checked on the kitty when she came out of it and she was warm... she actually stretched and felt comfy and happy. It works and I highly recommend it! Ordering a second one - just in case another soul needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Mirela

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor kitties
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for 3 years, I decided to get another one. I also have a smaller one, but the cats like this one the best, it allows them to stretch out. For winters I line the sides with silver board insulation and cover with a tarp to keep it extra warm and protect from the elements. I cover the back exit and put it up against the house. They really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Bond

customer_reviews.title: This was the 40 watt which I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This kitty hut apparently comes in either 20 watt or 40 watt heating pad. I chose this one because it gets really cold where we live and this offers better heat. It fits our 2 kitties and they are in it every night even though they have a barn to sleep in with hay. We have it under a carport up high but if I had to have it outside I would cover it with a tarp for added weatherproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats swear by this! ;-)
customer_reviews.text: My outdoor feral kitties are very attached to this little a-frame house. What is really nice is the heating pad inside is soft and cushiony, and has a fleecy top to it. We use this house inside our gazebo in the winter and we put a solar pool cover over the gazebo and brick it down- then we use these little houses and outdoor heating pads for our furry feral kitties who prefer to stay outside. It took them a little while to find this house and go inside it, and they liked it better when I put it on the lounge chair, but they will still use it no matter where it is.
customer_reviews.author: wdgolf

product_meta.title: K&H PET PRODUCTS Outdoor Multi-Kitty A-Frame Chocolate
product_meta.description: Size:Heated| Style:Retail BoxThis large, multi-cat kitty house is the perfect shelter for any outdoor cat. The water-resistant fabric and unique overhang roof design helps keep cats warm and dry and offers a comforting shelter that is large enough for up to 4 kitties. Includes and accommodates a medium K&H Outdoor Heated Bed. Available heated and also unheated, we can't think of anything more comforting to an outdoor cat a place to call home. No tools required for set up. These heated cat houses have been tested & certified by MET Labs to exceed USA/CA electrical safety standards.
feature_bullets: Heated cat house is perfect to keep community cats warm from outdoor freezing cold temperatures
The featured 40 watt MET Safety Listed heated bed inside keeps your kitties warm, even in sub-zero temperatures
The two exits include removable clear door flaps to protect kitty from the harsh elements of winter
Perfect for cats that sleep in garages, porches, barns, or even in the home
These heated cat houses have been tested & certified by MET Labs to exceed USA/CA electrical safety standards
One-year limited warranty; if you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
